page.title: 04PARISH CHURCHES
page.content: There are two parish churches, at Pyecombe and Clayton, but no Catholic or Free Church. Clayton Church is well known in the area for its wall paintings. Clayton has its own rector but Pyecombe has joined with 3 other parishes (Newtimber, Edburton and Poynings) with one rector shared between them. This means the number of services at Pyecombe has been cut drastically. Pyecombe Church is in the top half of the village which is divided into 2 parts: the original part around the church and the settlement along the A23 which was built when the plague hit the upper part of the village in 16O3. The building, mainly Norman, is very popular, particularly with walkers on the South Downs Way. Its age is now causing problems: recent replastering of a damp wall has been expensive.
